title: Town Hall: Sydney train station evacuated due to smoke
text:
Sydney's Town Hall station has come to a standstill following evacuation procedures due to fire and/or a gas leak.

Sydney’s Town Hall station has been completely evacuated during the morning commuter peak due to smoke.

Fire & Rescue NSW received a call at 9.33am today after a fire alarm was activated.

“We’ve confirmed there was smoke coming from a motor room,” a FRNSW spokeswoman told news.com.au.

“We evacuated Town Hall station at 9.38am.

“After investigations, there was a message that came through of ‘smoke issuing from plant room due to overheating bearing’.”

The station is still evacuated but trains will continue to come into Town Hall, she said.

More to come.

Update: Trains are now stopping again at Town Hall station due to an earlier fire alarm activation. ✅



Thanks for your patience. — Trains Info (@TrainsInfo) October 13, 2019

A fire alarm activation caused a temporary closure of Sydney’s Town Hall train station. Services have since resumed. https://t.co/78mgVkoDru — Twitter Moments Australia (@MomentsAU) October 13, 2019
description: Sydney’s Town Hall station has been completely evacuated during the morning commuter peak due to smoke.
